H0.text: What is the name of the device made of wood and horsehair that is used to play a violin. Fiddlestick

H1.text: What is the name of the device made of wood and horsehair that is used to play a violin. Hairbrush

H2.text: What is the name of the device made of wood and horsehair that is used to play a violin. Stringer

H3.text: What is the name of the device made of wood and horsehair that is used to play a violin. Bow

A4.text: In music, a bow () is a tensioned stick which has hair (usually horse-tail hair) coated in rosin (to facilitate friction) affixed to it.

A5.text: The Rawlins Gallery violin bow, NMM 4882, is attributed to the workshop of Antonio Stradivari, Cremona, c. 1700.
